title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Fed officials last month eyed a faster timetable for raising interest rates this year, potentially as soon as in March, amid greater discomfort with high inflation, minutes of their meeting showed.

Major stock indexes fell after the minutes' release, with the Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow sliding 3.3%, 1.9% and 1.1%, respectively.

---

AT&T's WarnerMedia and ViacomCBS are exploring a possible sale of a significant stake or all of the CW Network, which they jointly own.

---

Nearly 1,700 U.S. flights were canceled by Wednesday evening, the 11th straight day of more than 1,000 cancellations and the airline industry's worst stretch since the start of the pandemic.

---

News of battery-powered vehicles dominated the CES technology conference on Wednesday, the latest sign that the momentum around EVs continues to build.

---

Low-cost carrier Allegiant is ordering up to 100 Boeing 737 MAX jetliners, adding the U.S. manufacturer's planes to its Airbus-supplied fleet.

---

Shares of China Mobile closed above their offering price in the firm's Shanghai market debut, eight months after it left the NYSE.

---

Grammy Awards organizers postponed the event due to uncertainty around the Omicron variant.

---

Game developer Nexon is expanding into movies by taking a minority stake in production company AGBO.
